sub_title: Scientific Lead at TNO | Executive Board member of EASE | Subsurface Energy Storage | Hydrogen Storage and Transport | Offshore Energy | System Integration
summary:
Senior Geoscientist with technical, commercial, and management experience, gained during a 25-year career at the interface between applied research and industry. Passionate about the subsurface, and highly motivated to help organizations and society to exploit it in a safe, sustainable, and profitable manner. Experienced in innovative energy technologies that leverage the subsurface, such as large-scale energy storage, geothermal, and CCS, and sound knowledge of energy market dynamics. Solid understanding of the oil and gas upstream value chain. Result-driven and communicative, ‘get things done’ mentality, and keen eye for opportunities. 

Specialties: subsurface storage (gases, liquids, energy), geothermal energy, salt mining, petroleum geology, deep water sedimentology, geological process modelling, subsurface visualization techniques, scientific software development, scrum, scaled agile framework (SAFe).

projects:
[{'title': 'North Sea Energy programme - Harnessing the North Sea’s potential', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'description': 'Europe is moving towards a climate-neutral energy system that is reliable and affordable. The North Sea plays a key role in this. Traditionally with oil and gas production and now increasingly with renewable energy. The North Sea offers opportunities for large-scale wind energy and hydrogen production and underground carbon storage. 
Together with more than 30 (inter)national parties, the North Sea Energy programme researches how the North Sea’s potential using an integrated approach can be utilized for a climate-neutral energy system. The programme is investigating the benefits of smart linkages between the various energy functions in the North Sea. These benefits will save society money and time, enable us to use space effectively and considerably reduce carbon emissions. 
A key element of our programme is an integrated approach to the offshore energy portfolio. Previous studies by North Sea Energy have shown that benefits can be achieved if we wisely link the various energy functions, such as wind, hydrogen and natural gas. Wise connections reduce carbon emissions, reduce costs, makes effective use of offshore space and accelerates the energy transition. Good cooperation and coordination will enable us to seize opportunities and put the North Sea on the map as a pioneering region for the European energy transition.
The results of this multi-year R&D programme are downloadable from the NSE website, accessible via the "see project" link below.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Remco', 'last_name': 'Groenenberg', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Scientific Lead at TNO | Executive Board member of EASE | Subsurface Energy Storage | Hydrogen Storage and Transport | Offshore Energy | System Integration'}]}, {'title': 'HyStock pilot project - field-testing hydrogen storage in a salt cavern', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'description': 'The HyStock pilot project aims to assess the risks associated with hydrogen storage in a salt cavern, and conduct field tests in the subsurface under operational conditions to:
A. Validate the mechanical integrity and leak tightness ofmaterials and components
B. Investigate microbiological effects of storing hydrogen in a salt cavern
C. De-risk supply chain and
D. Gain (operational) experience with design, construction and workover (maintenance) procedures.

In this project TNO cooperates with partner EnergyStock/Gasunie (project coordinator).', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Remco', 'last_name': 'Groenenberg', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Scientific Lead at TNO | Executive Board member of EASE | Subsurface Energy Storage | Hydrogen Storage and Transport | Offshore Energy | System Integration'}]}, {'title': 'LSES - Large-Scale Energy Storage in salt caverns and depleted fields', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'description': 'TNO with partners EBN, Gasunie, Gasterra, NAM and Nouryon (now Nobian) conducted a joint-industry research project on large-scale subsurface energy storage in The Netherlands. The consortium assessed the value of hydrogen and compressed air storage technologies in the current and future Dutch energy system, and addressed key technical and non-technical hurdles that affect market implementation. 
The results of this one-year project, which was partly funded by the Dutch Government, are public an can be accessed via the "see project" link below.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Remco', 'last_name': 'Groenenberg', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Scientific Lead at TNO | Executive Board member of EASE | Subsurface Energy Storage | Hydrogen Storage and Transport | Offshore Energy | System Integration'}]}]

The European Association for Storage of Energy', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQEFuNBl4dI8yQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1519908368227?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=wIsOZAMaGe3mm4czvBoyvegtaWPBEzn33zOC8Xx-WKk', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/the-european-association-for-storage-of-energy/', 'employees': {'start': 2, 'end': 10}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': None, 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'EASE - The European Association for Storage of Energy', 'description': None, 'title': 'Executive Board Member', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 17912691, 'name': 'PDS Group', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQFWEkNjcnVwlg/company-logo_400_400/0/1519868712009?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=BJoXjBccDO30LkKuigGMO85t-1cKA6as2IJNdhiUsGc', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/pdsgroup/', 'employees': {'start': 51, 'end': 200}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Rijswijk, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'company': 'PDS Group', 'description': 'Managed a project team of geoscientists and software developers (15-20 fte) to perform R&D services for E&P clients in the Oil and Gas industry.
